page.title: 11MARBURY HOUSE
page.content: The lady we visited has been a resident at{Marbury House}for 8 years{ in August.She is 89 and has lived in Reddish since she was 65.She asked us if the laundrette was still on the corner of{Station}Rd.It is.She then asked if the butchers and grengrocers was still there,but they are not, instead there is a furniture and a Hoover shop. She said "shops are the main{changes in Reddish"}and then we talked about the place she lived in before, Failsworth in Manchester. She does not get out much, as she is getting old, but still goes out on trips with the home. During the day, she stays in her room and reads, as she says there isn't much conversation between the old people. Most evenings she goes into a big room to watch T.V.
